target_response: You can add a CSS rule to the second `Col` using media queries to apply the `marginTop` style only when the screen is sm or smaller. Here's an example: ``` {/* first column content */} ``` And then in your CSS file, add the following rule: ``` @media (max-width: 576px) { /* sm screen size */ .ant-col-xs-24.ant-col-sm-24.ant-col-md-12 + .ant-col-xs-24.ant-col-sm-24.ant-col-md-12 { margin-top: 30px; } } ``` This uses the adjacent sibling selector (`+`) to target the second `Col` only when it immediately follows the first `Col`. It also uses the `ant-col-` classes to target the `Col` element based on its size props (`xs`, `sm`, `md`).
